intro: Sphaerostephanos angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star-flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its star-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant has narrow, lanceolate leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to gardens and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
